result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CF182,  Count 1 in 15CM209,  Count 1 in 15CM218 and  Count 2 in 15CM227.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  Set for plea only.  PSI will be requested. 2/29/16 at 1:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant in custody.  Track with CF case.

Covers 15CM208 and 15CM209.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Walmart.

Pre-trial conference at 09-23-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-12-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael T Bearfield in court with attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Gerald R. Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of complaint for 15CM208 & 15CM209 and stands mute. Court advised charge and potential penalties. Bond conditions amended.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
